headline.main: Business and Health; Coping With Stress at Work

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: SEVERAL hundred companies are offering programs to help employees deal with stress, according to a survey to be published soon by the health-promotion office of the Department of Health and Human Services. But the economic and health value of such stress-management programs, aside from subjective feel-good reactions as measured over a few months, has yet to be established.
